hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class VariableType<T,MT extends ModelType<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.VariableType<T,MT>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the raw primitive type represented by this variable's value
    MT - the type of this variable (the type of its value)
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VariableBool, VariableInt, VariableString

    public abstract class VariableType<T,MT extends ModelType<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A mutable container of a specified ModelType instance.

    Represents: no model element directly

    Usage:

    Variables in the model might be used at almost any place where ModelType instances are. The difference comes from a restriction that a variable type cannot be the type of an attribute, neither be a return or parameter type of a model class constructor or operation ( VariableType does not implement ModelValue).

    The practical difference between instances of this class and ModelType objects is that the former are mutable whereas the latter are not. Therefore, VariableType instances may be used as variables inside the code blocks and condition evaluations given as parameters to If, While and For methods where Java lets the use of local variables of enclosing methods only if they are final or effectively final.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: allowed
    • Define subtype: disallowed

    Example: 

     
 VariableInt i = new VariableInt(10);
 Action.While( ()  -> i.get().isMore(ModelInt.ZERO), ()  -> { 
        Action.log("i is decreased by one");
        i.set(i.get().subtract(ModelInt.ONE));  
 });

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs
    See Also:
    VariableBool, VariableInt, VariableString, ModelType
